news.title: Apple takes control of all core chips in iPhone Air with new architecture to prioritize AI
news.summary: Apple is quietly taking control of all the core chips in iPhone with new architecture. New architecture to prioritize AI workloads on its most advanced chip, the A19 Pro.

news.title: Buffett's Berkshire totally exits its profitable stake in Chinese EV maker bought because of Munger
news.summary: Berkshire Hathaway has completed exited its extremely profitable equity investment in the Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD. Berkshire Hathaway had invested in BYD for more than a decade.

news.title: Trump aide denies Jimmy Kimmel suspended because of WH pressure despite Carr threat
news.summary: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt denied late-night TV host Jimmy Kimmel was suspended because of pressure from the Trump administration. She said Kimmel's suspension is not related to the White House.

news.title: Big Tech companies, foreign governments scramble after Trump slaps $100,000 fee on H-1B visas
news.summary: The announcement to impose a $100,000 annual fee on H-1B visas sent shockwaves through corporate America. The fee is expected to be in place by the end of the year.

news.title: What we know about the cyberattack that hit major European airports
news.summary: Brussels Airport said it expected heavy disruption and flight cancellations into Sunday as a result of the cyberattack. The cyberattack is believed to have been carried out by a group known as the North Korean government.

news.title: My mother’s lawyer stole $400K after she moved to a nursing home. How do we get our money back?
news.summary: Within a month, her home had fraudulently been put up for sale and her vehicle stolen, police say. “Within a week, her vehicle had been stolen,” police said.

news.title: Are your parents afraid of investing in crypto? How to talk with them so they’ll actually listen.
news.summary: ‘I was fearful,’ a father admits. ‘You should not be surprised to see 70% drawdown on alt coins and even bitcoin’

news.title: ‘Am I the biggest loser with the Fed rate cut?’ I’m 68, retired and live off IRAs and Social Security
news.summary: “I live a comfortable life, but the Fed’s decision won’t make a blind bit of difference to me,” he says.

news.title: I’m 88 and leaving my $450,000 estate to my son because he has children. Is that wrong?
news.summary: “My other children have relationships, but they are unmarried and have no children,” she said. “My daughter-in-law has a relationship, but she is unmarried and has no children.”

news.title: ‘I am highly alarmed by the proposed changes to retirement accounts’: I don’t want bitcoin or private equity in my 401(k). What can I do?
news.summary: “What are the options for safeguarding my autonomy over my funds?” she asks. “What is my right to my money?’”
